@description.name: @description
@description.body:
*****************************************************************

qooxdoo - the new era of web development http://qooxdoo.org Copyright: 2004-2008 1&1 Internet AG, Germany, http://www.1und1.de License: MIT: https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT See the LICENSE file in the project's top-level directory for details. Authors: Sebastian Werner (wpbasti) Andreas Ecker (ecker) Martin Wittemann (martinwittemann) Fabian Jakobs (fjakobs) *

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The RepeatButton is a special button, which fires repeatedly {@link #execute} events, while a button is pressed on the button. The initial delay and the interval time can be set using the properties {@link #firstInterval} and {@link #interval}. The {@link #execute} events will be fired in a shorter amount of time if a button is hold, until the min {@link #minTimer} is reached. The {@link #timerDecrease} property sets the amount of milliseconds which will decreased after every firing. 

   var button = new qx.ui.form.RepeatButton("Hello World");
   button.addListener("execute", function(e) {
     alert("Button is executed");
   }, this);
   this.getRoot.add(button);

This example creates a button with the label "Hello World" and attaches an event listener to the {@link #execute} event. External Documentation Documentation of this widget in the qooxdoo manual.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This event gets dispatched with every interval. The timer gets executed as long as the user holds down a button.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This event gets dispatched when the button is pressed.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This event gets dispatched when the button is released.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Interval used after the first run of the timer. Usually a smaller value than the "firstInterval" property value to get a faster reaction.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Interval used for the first run of the timer. Usually a greater value than the "interval" property value to a little delayed reaction at the first time.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This configures the minimum value for the timer interval.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Decrease of the timer on each interval (for the next interval) until minTimer reached.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Calling this function is like a tap from the user on the button with all consequences. Be sure to call the {@link #release} function.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Calling this function is like a release from the user on the button with all consequences. Usually the {@link #release} function will be called before the call of this function.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: fireExecuteEvent {Boolean?true} flag which signals, if an event should be fired
@param.description: flag which signals, if an event should be fired

@description.name: @description
@description.body: overridden

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Listener method for "pointerover" event

  • Adds state "hovered"
  • Removes "abandoned" and adds "pressed" state (if "abandoned" state is set)

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Listener method for "pointerout" event

  • Removes "hovered" state
  • Adds "abandoned" and removes "pressed" state (if "pressed" state is set)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Callback method for the "pointerdown" method. Sets the interval of the timer (value of firstInterval property) and starts the timer. Additionally removes the state "abandoned" and adds the state "pressed".

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Callback method for the "pointerup" event. Handles the case that the user is releasing a button before the timer interval method got executed. This way the "execute" method get executed at least one time.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Nothing to do, 'execute' is already fired by _onPointerUp.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Listener method for "keyup" event. Removes "abandoned" and "pressed" state (if "pressed" state is set) for the keys "Enter" or "Space" and stops the internal timer (same like pointer up).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Listener method for "keydown" event. Removes "abandoned" and adds "pressed" state for the keys "Enter" or "Space". It also starts the internal timer (same like pointerdown).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Callback for the interval event. Stops the timer and starts it with a new interval (value of the "interval" property - value of the "timerDecrease" property). Dispatches the "execute" event.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Starts the internal timer which causes firing of execution events in an interval. It also presses the button.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Stops the internal timer and releases the button.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set the command of this executable.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Return the current set command of this executable.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #interval}.
